children.name: to mix substances or liquids together
stir
children.definition: to mix things by moving them around in a container with a spoon or a stick: khuấy, quấy, trộn
examples: Stir the paint to make sure that the colours are thoroughly mixed.
Stir the paint to make sure it is smooth.
stir sth with sth
She stirred her coffee with a plastic spoon.
stir sth into sth
Stir a cup of cooked brown rice into the mixture.
I watched him as he stirred sugar into his coffee.
stir in[M]
When the butter has melted, stir in the soy sauce and ginger.
Add the grated cheese to the sauce and stir it in.

children.name: mix
children.definition: tomixdifferent liquids or substances together so that they can no longer be separated: trộn , pha lẫn ,hòa lẫn
examples: mix sth andsth
▪ You can make green by mixing blue and yellow paint.
mix sth together
▪ Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl.
▪ If these two chemicals are mixed together, they will explode.
mixsth withsth
▪ Concrete is made by mixing gravel with sand, cement, and water.

children.name: dilute
children.definition: to mix a liquid with water in order to make it weaker:pha loãng
examples: ▪ For babies, dilute the fruit juice with at least the same amount of water.
dilute sth with sth
▪ Concentrated bleach can be diluted with water.

children.name: combine
children.definition: /kəmˈbaɪn/  to mix different substances or liquids together thoroughly in order to produce a new substance or liquid: kết hợp
examples: combine something and something
▪ Combine the egg yolks and the cream, and cook over a low heat.
combine something with something
▪ Steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.
▪ To maintain a constant standard, some wine producers combine this year’s wine with stocks from the previous year.

children.name: substances that have been mixed together
mixture
children.definition: several different liquids or substances that have been mixed together,especially so that they form one thing: hỗn hợp
examples: Place all the ingredients in a bowl and beat them until the mixture is smooth.
The car runs on a special ether-alcohol mixture that won’t work in an ordinary engine.
mixture of
A special mixture of peat and soil is used for growing bonsai trees.
Fill the bread with a mixture of lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers.
Pour the mixture into four small dishes.

children.name: compound
children.definition: a mixture of two or more chemical substances that combine to produce a single substance with qualities that are different from the original substances - use this in scientific or technical contexts: hợp chất
examples: The soil was tested to make sure that it was free from ammonia or any other nitrogen compound.
chemical compound
Sulphur dioxide and carbon dioxide are two common chemical compounds

children.name: combination
children.definition: a mixtureof different substances, colours etc that are used together: hỗn hợp
examples: ▪ Banana, orange juice, and cream may seem an odd combination, but together they make a delicious drink.
combination of
▪ The sweater is made of a combination of natural and synthetic fibres.

children.name: solution
children.definition: a liquid that has sth mixed in with it - use this in scientific contexts:dung dịch
examples: Make a salt solution by dissolving 9 tablespoonfuls of cooking salt in a pint of water.
We are now going to measure the boiling points of the different solutions.

children.name: mix
children.definition: /mɪks/  hòa lẫn
examples: ▪ Oil and water do not mix.
▪ After a short time the oxygen and the nitrogen molecules will start to mix.
mix with
▪ A heater introduces warm air to mix with incoming cold air.

children.name: combine
children.definition: if two or more substances or liquids combine, they mix to produce a new substance:
examples: ▪ When the two chemicals combine, they form an explosive compound.
combine with
▪ Greenhouse gases combine with hydrocarbons to form smog.

children.name: mingle
children.definition: /ˈmɪŋgəl/  if two or more liquids, smells, sounds etc mingle, they mix but can still be recognized separately: trộn lẫn
examples: Add the mint and allow the flavours to mingle.
▪ The noise was tremendous; bombs, guns, and engines mingled in discordant sound.
mingle with
▪ The smell of the sea mingled with the faint scent of the grass.
▪ Water spread across the floor in a greasy stream, mingling with the pile of filthy rubbish.
Her perfume mingled with the smell of wood smoke from the fire.

children.name: mixed up
children.definition: /ˌmɪkst ˈʌp◂/  things such as papers, clothes, or objects that are mixed up are put together untidily when they do not belong together, or are in the wrong order: lẫn lộn
examples: ▪ The drawer was full of mixed up bits of paper, old letters, and photographs.
▪ The tapes are a bit mixed up, but it shouldn’t take too long to sort them out.

children.name: jumbled
children.definition: /jumbled up/jumbled together/ˈdʒʌmbəld, ˌdʒʌmbəld ˈʌp, ˌdʒʌmbəld təˈgeðəʳ/  things such as papers, books, clothes etc that are jumbled are mixed together very untidily, especially in a pile, so that it is difficult to find anything: lộn xộn
examples: ▪ A jumbled collection of clothes lay on the floor.
▪ The rucksack contains several pockets to prevent odds and ends getting jumbled up.
▪ a drawer full of letters all jumbled together

children.name: tangled
children.definition: /ˈtæŋgəld/  hair, grass, string etc that istangledis mixed up and difficult to separate:rối, lộn xộn
examples: ▪ He ran a hand through his tangled hair.
▪ The concrete highway was edged with tangled dry grass.

children.name: a mixture of different people, ideas, etc
mixture
children.definition: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people : hỗn hợp
examples: The house behind us was a strange architectural mixture.
mixture of
He looked at her with a mixture of admiration and curiosity.
A long French liner slipped majestically by with a mixture of European and Asian faces staringcuriously from the decks.
The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
the mixture of different people living in the city
She felt a strange mixture of excitement and fear.
a mixture of emotions

children.name: combination
children.definition: a mixture of different ideas, problems etc happening together, or different people working together, which has a particular effect: sự kết hợp
examples: combination of
▪ Our problems were due to a combination of bad management and lack of experience.
▪ Their music is an odd combination of jazz and opera.
a good/bad/successful/disastrous etc combination
▪ They were a perfect combination - Anton as chef and Guy as restaurant manager.
a winning combinationa very successful combination
▪ If all the team are playing well, then don’t change a winning combination.

children.name: mix
children.definition: a mixture of different qualities or of different types of people: sự trộn lẫn, pha trộn
examples: mix of
The market square is a fascinating mix of ancient and modern.
She went to New York, where she began to meet a different mix of people -- artists, designers, and art collectors.

children.name: blend
children.definition: a mixture of different qualities or characteristics that combine successfully:sự pha trộn
examples: blend of
The England team is a good side, with a nice blend of experience and youthful energy.
Sometimes he seems to be an extraordinary blend of artist, poet and businessman.

children.name: cross
children.definition: a  between sth and sth sth that is across betweenone thing and another is a mixture of the two different things:sự kết hợp giữa cái gì đó và cái gì đó
examples: The expression on Paul’s face was a cross between amusement and disbelief.
It’s difficult to describe my job. I suppose I’m a cross between a secretary and a translator.
The use of chemical fertilizers has turned the farmer into a cross between an industrial chemist and a mechanic.

children.name: fusion
children.definition: sth such as a style of art or writing that is produced by combining different ideas, styles, qualities etc:sự kết hợp, “hỗn hợp nấu chảy”
examples: fusion of
The film is a fusion of history and contemporary events.
His philosophy is a fusion of intellect and spiritual belief.

children.name: hybrid
children.definition: sth that is a mixture of two or more things : “lai tạo”
examples: hybrid of
The new constitution was a hybrid of presidential and parliamentary systems.
a hybrid system/approach/method etc
a hybrid approach combining the merits of both methods

children.name: to mix feelings ideas, styles etc
combine
children.definition: to have different qualities or feelings at the same time, or to do very different activities at the same time: kết hợp
examples: combine something with something
▪ This is a computer system that combines maximum flexibility with absolute accuracy.
combine something and something
▪ He designed the first great suspension bridge, an idea that combines beauty and function perfectly.

children.name: be a mixture of
children.definition: sth and sth to contain different features or ideas, mixed together:là sự kết hợp của
examples: ▪ Her work is a mixture of classical and modern styles.
▪ Billy’s voice was a mixture of apprehension and indignation.

children.name: bring together
children.definition: /ˌbrɪŋ təˈgeðəʳ/  if you bring together two or more elements, ideas, or characteristics, you mix them so that they can be seen at the same time: tập hợp, kết hợp với nhau
examples: ▪ It is a marvellous book, which brings together all the necessary elements of romance and adventure.
▪ These opposing views should be brought together in a single paragraph, to form the conclusion to your essay.

children.name: blend
children.definition: /blend/  if a piece of work, a film, a book etc blends two or more features or characteristics, it mixes them successfully: pha trộn
examples: blend something and something
▪ The ballet company’s repertoire blends tradition and creative innovation.
blend something with something
▪ Her first novel successfully blends a sense of innocence with overwhelming bitterness.

children.name: mingle
children.definition: to show two very different characteristics or feelings at the same time, mixing them together:kết hợp
examples: Heraklion mingles traditional charm with a bustling centre of pavement cafes and shops.
mingle something with something
Mingling genuine news with gossip, she made a lively companion.
be mingled with something
Her excitement was mingled with a slight feeling of fear.

children.name: merge
children.definition: to combine or join two things together to form one thing:hợp nhất
examples: merge something with something
The library profession is merging new techniques with old to produce an unbeatable combination of management skills.

children.name: different emotions that are mixed together
mixed
children.definition: /mɪkst/  lẫn lộn
examples: ▪ Reactions to the announcement were somewhat mixed.
have mixed feelings/emotions
▪ The other girls had mixed feelings, some of them were happy for me but some were jealous.
▪ Many new step-parents will admit to having mixed emotions about their new family.

children.name: combined
children.definition: showing two very different feelings or emotions at the same time: lẫn lộn
examples: ▪ He had an air of combined gloom and relief.
combined with
▪ Their relief that war had been avoided was combined with sadness at what they had lost.

children.name: mingled
children.definition: /ˈmɪŋgəld/  mixed, but still felt or shown as separate emotions: lẫn lộn
examples: ▪ The mingled emotions that haunted his mind were reflected in his eyes.
mingled with
▪ As I spoke his expression was one of amazement mingled with fury.

children.name: when different things do not mix well
not mix
children.definition: do /ˌduː nɒt ˈmɪks/  if two different kinds of behaviour or activity do not mix, you cannot successfully continue with both of them at the same time:không thể kết hợp
examples: ▪ People having affairs at work often find that business and romance don’t mix.
do not mix with
▪ Heavy drinking does not mix with a successful family life.

children.name: incompatible
children.definition: if two things or people areincompatible, they cannot easily exist together, work together, or live together: xung khắc, không tương thích, không hợp nhau
examples: The centre gives advice to women who find the demands of marriage and work incompatible.
After we got married, we realized we were completely incompatible.
incompatible with
These computers are incompatible with our present system.

children.name: not go well together
children.definition: do /ˌduː nɒt gəʊ ˈwel təˌgeðəʳ/  if two ideas, characteristics etcdo not go well together, they do not mix easily or well:khó hòa hợp
examples: ▪ In the experience of many European countries, socialism and religion do not go well together.
